content.question:
Milkshake Cups
 Total Utility (utils)

<math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="145" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>145</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="185" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>185</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="220" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>220</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Which of the following is true based on Rosco’s utility data given in the table provided?

choices.label: Rosco’s marginal utility from the fourth cup is <math alttext="185" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>185</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> utils.
Rosco’s marginal utility from the fifth cup is <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> utils.
Rosco’s marginal utility from the third cup is greater than the marginal utility from the second cup.
Rosco’s marginal utility from the fourth cup is greater than the marginal utility from the third cup.
Rosco’s total utility and marginal utility both increase as he consumes more cups of milkshake.

content.answer: Rosco’s marginal utility from the fifth cup is <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> utils.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
